results.title: Tristan and Isolt = Lovespell
results.creator_credit: Clar Productions, Tom Hayes, Claire Labine and Tom Donovan
results.brief_description: A celtic medieval story of love, betrayal and tragedy within a 9th century Irish monarchy. Stars Richard Burton (Mark, King of Cornwall), Kate Mulgrew (Isolt), Nicholas Clay (Tristan) with Cyril Cusack, Geraldine Fitzgerald and Niall Toibin. Music by The Chieftains.

results.title: Tripwire (A)
results.creator_credit: David Hirst, Valerie Morton and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A character and action driven true-life adventure documentary looking at the Australian Armys secret Norforce unit that forms this Island continents first line of defence across the remote Kimberly region and the Northern Territory. Norforce is also one of the msot dynamic experiments in inter-racial relations as the unit is made up of both white and Aboriginal Australians where the soldiers learn essential survival skills from each other. Narrated by Archie Roach, and featuring the music of the Warumpi Band.

results.title: Triple word score [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jane Keneally, AFTRS and Armagan Ballantyne
results.brief_description: Sisters Phyllis and Hazel prefer to communicate via the Scrabble board. When a stranger joins their midst, albeit briefly, they are forced to question their circumstances, and the nature of their relationship. Cast includes Iris Shand, Dorothy Cox and Ben Gabriel.

results.title: Triple trouble
results.creator_credit: Essanay Film Manufacturing Company, Charles Chaplin and Leo White
results.brief_description: A slapstick comedy starring Charlie Chaplin as a screwball kitchenhand who unwittingly foils Colonel W. Nutt’s scientific research and in the process involves everyone around him in a search for local train robbers. Also stars: Billy Armstrong, Albert Austin, Henry Bergman, Bud Jamison, James J. Kelley, ‘Snub’ Pollard, Edna Purviance, Wesley Ruggles and Leo White.

results.title: Tripe. Sharkey's party
results.creator_credit: Peter Lawless, Lawless Enterprises and Greg Woodland
results.brief_description: Tripe (1985): Gothic spoof in which four grown children read cookbooks for pleasure having been fed a steady diet of tripe by their domineering father and Victorian aunt Esme - until things get even blacker. Cast includes John Meillon, Gary Waddell, Sally McKenzie, Cate Brennan, Tim Ailwood and Steve Houston. “Sharkey’s Party” (1986): A less angst counterpoint to “Dogs in Space”. Having just come out of a mental institiution Sharkey’s friends throw him a party. Musicians, jaded punks, out-of-date hippies, sharehouses, drugs and life on the dole make up this portrayal of Australian youth culture in the 1980’s. Cast includes David Argue and Sally McKenzie.

results.title: Trio: exploring threads and textiles
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Ross Campbell
results.brief_description: A film for classroom teachers. Presents three different teachers in three different schools who have their own special way of incorporating Threads and Textiles into their program of Art Education. These teachers do not represent a random sample of teachers involved in using the course, but were simply selected because they were eager to introduce Threads and Textiles in to the classroom.

results.title: Trio for three angles
results.brief_description:
Animated free-swinging angles help students discover the relationships of a triangle’s different components. Shows separate sections of equilateral, isosceles and scalene trangles.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Trinity House
results.brief_description: On Tower Hill stands the fire-scarred shell of Trinity House; but although this building was damaged during World War 2, the work of the organisation it housed goes on regardless of war or bombs. Trinity House is responsible for the administration and maintenance of Britain’s 1217 lighthouses, 87 lightships, and countless buoys, pilot boats, markers, and other aids to navigation. Trinity House pilots steer ships through shoals and past hidden reefs and rocks in British waters.

results.title: Trik film three
results.creator_credit: Eccentric Circle Cinema Workshop and George Griffin
results.brief_description: A film experiment which uses one of the oldest methods of simple animation. The artist draws a series of pictures of a simple set of actions in progression. These are then stacked in the hand and flipped through to form a moving image. Useful for film making classes. Without commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eccentric Circle Cinema Workshop and George Griffin
